intro: Muhlenbergia reverchonii, commonly known as the desert muhlenbergia, is a perennial grass native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit, with slender, wiry stems and fine, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flower clusters in late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Muhlenbergia reverchonii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
